Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class BoundedStudentContainer

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.BoundedStudentContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Jsonable, StudentContainerInterface
final class BoundedStudentContainer extends Object implements StudentContainerInterface
This class represents a Container of students with a fixed maximum number of Students that it can contain. This behaviour is typical of different game entities, e.g. the school entrance or the Sack.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final int
    maxSize
    The maximum number of students that can be inside the Container.
    private StudentContainer
    wrapped
    An internal StudentContainer used for storing students.

    • BoundedStudentContainer

      BoundedStudentContainer (int maxSize) throws IllegalArgumentException
      A constructor that allows to create the BoundedContainer object specifying the maximum number of students.
      Parameters:
      maxSize - the maximum number of students
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the maxSize passed is lower or equals to zero

    • BoundedStudentContainer

      BoundedContainer constructor that creates a copy of the one passed via parameter.
      Parameters:
      oldContainer - the BoundedContainer to copy
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if che container passed is null

    • add

      public BoundedStudentContainer add (Student s) throws IllegalArgumentException, ContainerIsFullException
      This method allows to add a Student to the container, and returns a copy of the container containing that student.
      Specified by:
      add in interface StudentContainerInterface
      Parameters:
      s - the student to add
      Returns:
      the new container instance including the new student
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the student to add is null
      ContainerIsFullException - if the container reached the maximum size
      ColorIsFullException - never thrown

    • remove

      public Tuple<BoundedStudentContainer,Student> remove() throws EmptyContainerException
      This method removes a random Student from the container, and returns it with a new container instance, not containing the removed student.

      Returns:

    • remove

      public Tuple<BoundedStudentContainer,Student> remove (PieceColor color) throws EmptyContainerException, EmptyStackException, IllegalArgumentException

      Specified by:
      remove in interface StudentContainerInterface
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the student to remove
      Returns:
      A Tuple<Container, Student> with the new container instance and the removed student
      Throws:
      EmptyStackException - if there are no students of the specified color in the container
      IllegalArgumentException - if the color passed is null
